summary: Skunks are unique mammals known for their powerful stinky spray. They belong to the Mephitidae family and are related to weasels and polecats. These creatures have distinctive warning colors, ranging from black and white to various shades of brown and cream. Skunks have a special defense mechanism where they can spray a liquid from their anal glands, which has an extremely strong, unpleasant odor. Interestingly, their closest relatives are the Old World stink badgers.
title: Skunk
